body_html:
I was reading AMD itself knows their latest proprietary driver (at least on linux) is shit with SPIR.

Then, it's legit that you just claim as "supported" (even though maybe a better word could be tested or certified) platforms you tested.. But I think it's pretty blatant that "somehow broken support" is different than no support at all.

p.s. I'm not sure why in the world they'd drop SPIR, considering SPIR-V is part of core CL 2.1, vulkan, and soon even vulkanCL or whatever they are gonna call it.
p.p.s hope you are gonna fix those docs 🙃 :

  • bring back that amd-4 note description
  • recheck your results in light of everything people said in #22 (TL;DR amdgpu-pro is supposedly working)
  • idk about ubuntu (as I linked above), but reliable patches to get fglrx to work even on 4.15 are available for both fedora and arch - and for as much certainly unofficial, a slim hint could really make the day for many people/newcomers

p.s. I'm not sure why in the world they'd drop SPIR, considering SPIR-V is part of core CL 2.1, vulkan, and soon even vulkanCL or whatever they are gonna call it.
p.p.s hope you are gonna fix those docs 🙃 :

recheck your results in light of everything people said in #22 (TL;DR amdgpu-pro is supposedly working)
idk about ubuntu (as I linked above), but reliable patches to get fglrx to work even on 4.15 are available for both fedora and arch - and for as much certainly unofficial, a slim hint could really make the day for many people/newcomers
body:
I was reading AMD itself [knows](https://community.amd.com/thread/221158#2832345) their latest proprietary driver (at least on linux) is shit with SPIR. 

Then, it's legit that you just claim as "supported" (even though maybe a better word could be tested or certified) platforms you tested.. But I think it's pretty blatant that "_somehow_ broken support" is different than no support at all. 

p.s. I'm not sure why in the world they'd drop SPIR, considering SPIR-V is part of core CL 2.1, vulkan, and soon even vulkanCL or whatever they are gonna call it. 
p.p.s hope you are gonna fix those docs 🙃 :
* bring back that amd-4 note description
* recheck your results in light of everything people said in #22 (TL;DR amdgpu-pro is supposedly working)
* idk about ubuntu (as I linked above), but reliable patches to get fglrx to work even on 4.15 are available for both [fedora](https://github.com/imageguy/fglrx-for-Fedora) and [arch](https://aur.archlinux.org/packages/catalyst-total/) - and for as much certainly unofficial, a slim hint could really make the day for _many_ people/newcomers
